citation.case_name: Postal Telegraph Cable Co. v. Baltimore

html:
156 U.S. 210

15 S.Ct. 356

39 L.Ed. 399

POSTAL TELEGRAPH CABLE CO.
v.
MAYOR, ETC., OF BALTIMORE.

No. 828.

January 28, 1895.

George H. Bates, for plaintiff in error.

Thomas G. Hayes and W. S. Bryan, Jr., for defendant in error.

Mr. Chief Justice FULLER.

1

The judgment is affirmed, upon the authority of City of St. Louis v. Western Union Tel. Co., 148 U. S. 92, 13 Sup. Ct. 485.
html_lawbox:
156 U.S. 210 (1895)

POSTAL TELEGRAPH CABLE COMPANY
v.
BALTIMORE.

No. 828.

Supreme Court of United States.

Submitted January 21, 1895.
Decided January 28, 1895.
ERROR TO THE COURT OF APPEALS OF THE STATE OF MARYLAND.

*211 Mr. Thomas G. Hayes and Mr. William S. Bryan, Jr., for the motion.

Mr. George H. Bates opposing.

THE CHIEF JUSTICE: The judgment is affirmed upon the authority of St. Louis v. Western Union Tel. Co., 148 U.S. 92.
